page.title: 09CHURCHES (CONTINUED)
page.content: {ST. MARK'S CHURCH}is a modern Church of England building. It was established in the 1960's as a temporary building to cater for the new Queensway estate. A permanent building was completed in the late 1970's and the Church is now an active part of the community in this part of Wellingborough. Church of England services are conducted by priests who after a period of study at theological college are ordained by a Bishop. After a time of apprenticeship in a parish as curate to the priest, it is then possible for an ordained person to have charge of a parish of his own.
